Page.title: Latest Articles
Page._content:
<font size=2>

###### [Connection Migration in QUIC](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-tan-quic-connection-migration/)
This document explores and classifies QUIC connection migration, and suggests possible improvements.


###### [PCM: Proactive Connection Migration in QUIC](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/344329901_PCM_Proactive_Connection_Migration_in_QUIC)
QUIC provides a secure, reliable and low-latency communication foundation for HTTP. QUIC uses a 64 bits random number as the connection ID to uniquely determine a connection from client to server. After the user switches the network, the server recognizes the user request according to the connection ID and continues to provide services through the connection migration technology. However, the current connection migration is passive, which is used to support mobile handover and weak network scenarios. This paper proposes a Proactive Connection Migration (PCM) mechanism for QUIC. PCM gives QUIC the ability to select the optimal network in a heterogeneous network environment. Firstly, PCM actively perceives the different networks available to users. Then, PCM integrates the network quality exploration of different paths into the user’s multiple request actions. Finally, PCM takes response delay and jitter into account, and uses online learning to find the optimal network for current Internet service. Experimental results show that, compared with original QUIC, the average response delay of QUIC with PCM is reduced by 59.43% at most.
Page.raw:

Connection Migration in QUIC

This document explores and classifies QUIC connection migration, and suggests possible improvements.

PCM: Proactive Connection Migration in QUIC

QUIC provides a secure, reliable and low-latency communication foundation for HTTP. QUIC uses a 64 bits random number as the connection ID to uniquely determine a connection from client to server. After the user switches the network, the server recognizes the user request according to the connection ID and continues to provide services through the connection migration technology. However, the current connection migration is passive, which is used to support mobile handover and weak network scenarios. Post.title: What is OpenQUIC?
Post._content:
Welcome to [OpenQUIC](https://www.openquic.net/)! The experience of TCP tells us that protocol expansion through patching will cause the protocol stack to become complex and fragile. We are committed to improving the innovation, scalability and compatibility of QUIC by standardizing QUIC components, which is called OpenQUIC.

OpenQUIC: software-defined transmission like building blocks
Click [Article](http://www.openquic.net/article) for more info. You can join us on [GitHub](https://github.com/OpenQUIC/OpenQUIC).
